016package de.cuioss.test.jsf.converter;
017
018import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertEquals;
019import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertThrows;
020import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.fail;
021
022import javax.faces.component.UIComponent;
023import javax.faces.component.html.HtmlInputText;
024import javax.faces.context.FacesContext;
025import javax.faces.convert.Converter;
026import javax.faces.convert.ConverterException;
027
028import org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach;
029import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
030
031import de.cuioss.test.generator.junit.EnableGeneratorController;
032import de.cuioss.test.jsf.config.ComponentConfigurator;
033import de.cuioss.test.jsf.config.decorator.ComponentConfigDecorator;
034import de.cuioss.test.jsf.junit5.EnableJsfEnvironment;
035import de.cuioss.test.jsf.junit5.JsfEnabledTestEnvironment;
036import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.objects.ConfigurationCallBackHandler;
037import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.objects.impl.DefaultInstantiator;
038import de.cuioss.tools.reflect.MoreReflection;
039import lombok.AccessLevel;
040import lombok.Getter;
041import lombok.Setter;
042
043/**
044 * Base class for testing implementations of {@link Converter} within a Junit 5
045 * context
046 * <h3>Setup</h3>
047 * <p>
048 * The actual test must provide {@link EnableJsfEnvironment}, for the basic
049 * test-infrastructure. See the class-documentation for details.
050 * </p>
051 * <p>
052 * {@link #initConverter()}: Instantiates the concrete {@link Converter} using
053 * reflection. After this the method calls {@link #configure(Object)} that can
054 * be used for further configuration of the {@link Converter}
055 * </p>
056 * <p>
057 * In case you want you want to create the {@link Converter} yourself you can
058 * overwrite {@link #getConverter()}
059 * </p>
060 * <p>
061 * In case you want a pass another {@link UIComponent} as parameter to the
062 * {@link Converter} you can overwrite {@link #getComponent()}
063 * </p>
064 * <h3>Test-Methods</h3> The core test-methods are:
065 * <ul>
066 * <li>{@link #shouldFailOnInvalidObjects()}</li>
067 * <li>{@link #shouldFailOnInvalidStrings()}</li>
068 * <li>{@link #shouldPassOnValidObjects()}</li>
069 * <li>{@link #shouldPassOnValidStrings()}</li>
070 * <li>{@link #shouldRoundTripValidData()}</li>
071 * </ul>
072 * They call {@link #populate(TestItems)} in oder to create corresponding
073 * test-data. The implementation is in the actual test-class.
074 * <h3>API-Test</h3> The api as defined within {@link Converter} is tested with
075 * the methods
076 * <ul>
077 * <li>{@link #shouldFailOnNullComponentOnGetAsObject()}</li>
078 * <li>{@link #shouldFailOnNullComponentOnGetAsString()}</li>
079 * <li>{@link #shouldFailOnNullFacesContextOnGetAsObject()}</li>
080 * <li>{@link #shouldFailOnNullFacesContextOnGetAsString()}</li>
081 * <li>{@link #shouldReturnEmptyStringOnNullValue()}</li>
082 * </ul>
083 * <h3>Example</h3> Shows all variants of dealing with {@link TestItems}
084 *
085 * <pre>
086 * <code>
087 * &#64;EnableJsfEnvironment
088 * class IntegerConverterTest extends AbstractConverterTest&lt;IntegerConverter, Integer&gt; {
089 *
090 * &#64;Override
091 * public void populate(final TestItems&lt;Integer&gt; testItems) {
092 * testItems.addRoundtripValues("1", "122", "2132121").addInvalidString("a")
093 * .addInvalidStringWithMessage("a", "javax.faces.converter.IntegerConverter.INTEGER")
094 * .addInvalidObject(Boolean.TRUE)
095 * .addInvalidObjectWithMessage(Boolean.FALSE, "javax.faces.converter.STRING")
096 * .addValidString("13").addValidStringWithObjectResult("17", Integer.valueOf(17))
097 * .addValidObject(Integer.valueOf(2))
098 * .addValidObjectWithStringResult(Integer.valueOf(14), "14");
099 * }
100 * </code>
101 * </pre>
102 *
103 * @param <C> identifying the concrete {@link Converter} to be tested.
104 * @param <T> identifying the type of elements to be used for values to be given
105 *            to the {@link Converter}
106 *
107 * @author Oliver Wolff
108 */
109@SuppressWarnings({ "rawtypes", "unchecked" }) // owolff we need to migrate this aspect later
110@EnableGeneratorController
111public abstract class AbstractConverterTest<C extends Converter, T> extends JsfEnabledTestEnvironment
112        implements ConfigurationCallBackHandler<C>, ComponentConfigurator {
113
114    private static final String SHOULD_HAVE_THROWN_CONVERTER_EXCEPTION = "Should have thrown ConverterException for invalid Value: ";
115
116    @Getter
117    @Setter
118    private UIComponent component = new HtmlInputText();
119
120    @Getter
121    private C converter;
122
123    @Getter(AccessLevel.PROTECTED)
124    private TestItems<T> testItems;
125
126    /**
127     * Instantiates and initially configures a concrete {@link Converter}
128     */
129    @BeforeEach
130    protected void initConverter() {
131        final Class<C> klazz = MoreReflection.extractFirstGenericTypeArgument(getClass());
132        converter = new DefaultInstantiator<>(klazz).newInstance();
133        configure(converter);
134        testItems = new TestItems<>();
135        populate(testItems);
136    }
137
138    /**
139     * Populates the test-items
140     *
141     * @param testItems to be populated, is never null
142     */
143    public abstract void populate(TestItems<T> testItems);
144
145    /**
146     * Callback method for interacting with the {@link ComponentConfigDecorator} at
147     * the correct time.<br>
148     * This method provide <b>extension point</b> to prepare needed test environment
149     * for your converter test. For example :
150     *
151     * <pre>
152     *    // register some converter
153     *    decorator.registerConverter(MyRequiredConverter.class);
154     *    // register UIComponent
155     *      ...
156     * </pre>
157     *
158     * @param decorator {@link ComponentConfigDecorator} is never null
159     */
160    @Override
161    public void configureComponents(final ComponentConfigDecorator decorator) {
162        // default do nothing
163    }
164
165    /**
166     * Checks the api contract regarding {@code null} as parameter for
167     * {@link UIComponent}, see
168     * {@link Converter#getAsObject(FacesContext, UIComponent, String)}
169     */
170    @Test
171    void shouldFailOnNullComponentOnGetAsObject() {
172        assertThrows(NullPointerException.class, () -> getConverter().getAsObject(getFacesContext(), null, null));
173    }
174
175    /**
176     * Checks the api contract regarding {@code null} as parameter for
177     * {@link FacesContext}, see
178     * {@link Converter#getAsObject(FacesContext, UIComponent, String)}
179     */
180    @Test
181    void shouldFailOnNullFacesContextOnGetAsObject() {
182        assertThrows(NullPointerException.class, () -> getConverter().getAsObject(null, getComponent(), null));
183    }
184
185    /**
186     * Checks the api contract regarding {@code null} as parameter for
187     * {@link UIComponent}, see
188     * {@link Converter#getAsString(FacesContext, UIComponent, Object)}
189     */
190    @Test
191    void shouldFailOnNullComponentOnGetAsString() {
192        assertThrows(NullPointerException.class, () -> getConverter().getAsString(getFacesContext(), null, null));
193    }
194
195    /**
196     * Checks the api contract regarding {@code null} as parameter for
197     * {@link FacesContext}, see
198     * {@link Converter#getAsString(FacesContext, UIComponent, Object)}
199     */
200    @Test
201    void shouldFailOnNullFacesContextOnGetAsString() {
202        assertThrows(NullPointerException.class, () -> getConverter().getAsString(null, getComponent(), null));
203    }
204
205    /**
206     * Checks the api contract regarding {@code null} as parameter for the actual
207     * value, see {@link Converter#getAsString(FacesContext, UIComponent, Object)}
208     */
209    @Test
210    void shouldReturnEmptyStringOnNullValue() {
211        assertEquals("", getConverter().getAsString(getFacesContext(), getComponent(), null));
212    }
213
214    /**
215     * Core test for converter testing. It collects the test-data using
216     * {@link TestItems} and iterates them for the individual test. For each element
217     * there will be called the method
218     * {@link Converter#getAsObject(javax.faces.context.FacesContext, javax.faces.component.UIComponent, String)},
219     * with the result again
220     * {@link Converter#getAsString(javax.faces.context.FacesContext, javax.faces.component.UIComponent, Object)}
221     * with the result being checked against the initial value.
222     */
223    @Test
224    void shouldRoundTripValidData() {
225        for (final String value : getTestItems().getRoundtripValues()) {
226            final var converted = (T) getConverter().getAsObject(getFacesContext(), getComponent(), value);
227            final var roundTripped = getConverter().getAsString(getFacesContext(), getComponent(), converted);
228            assertEquals(value, roundTripped);
229        }
230    }
231
232    /**
233     * Tests the method
234     * {@link Converter#getAsString(javax.faces.context.FacesContext, javax.faces.component.UIComponent, Object)}
235     * with invalid objects, derived by {@link TestItems}
236     */
237    @Test
238    void shouldFailOnInvalidObjects() {
239        for (final ConverterTestItem<T> item : getTestItems().getInvalidObjectTestItems()) {
240            try {
241                getConverter().getAsString(getFacesContext(), getComponent(), item.getTestValue());
242                fail(SHOULD_HAVE_THROWN_CONVERTER_EXCEPTION + item);
243            } catch (final ConverterException e) {
244                verifyExpectedErrorMessage(item, e);
245            }
246        }
247    }
248
249    private void verifyExpectedErrorMessage(final ConverterTestItem<T> item, final ConverterException e) {
250        // Check message
251        if (null != item.getErrorMessage()) {
252            assertEquals(item.getErrorMessage(), e.getFacesMessage().getSummary(),
253                    "Wrong error message detected. TestItem was : " + item);
254        }
255    }
256
257    /**
258     * Tests the method
259     * {@link Converter#getAsString(javax.faces.context.FacesContext, javax.faces.component.UIComponent, Object)}
260     * with valid objects, derived by {@link TestItems}
261     */
262    @Test
263    void shouldPassOnValidObjects() {
264        for (final ConverterTestItem<T> item : getTestItems().getValidObjectTestItems()) {
265            final var result = getConverter().getAsString(getFacesContext(), getComponent(), item.getTestValue());
266            if (null != item.getStringValue()) {
267                assertEquals(item.getStringValue(), result, item.toString());
268            }
269        }
270    }
271
272    /**
273     * Tests the method
274     * {@link Converter#getAsObject(javax.faces.context.FacesContext, javax.faces.component.UIComponent, String)}
275     * with invalid objects, derived by {@link TestItems}
276     */
277    @Test
278    void shouldFailOnInvalidStrings() {
279        for (final ConverterTestItem<T> item : getTestItems().getInvalidStringTestItems()) {
280            try {
281                getConverter().getAsObject(getFacesContext(), getComponent(), item.getStringValue());
282                fail(SHOULD_HAVE_THROWN_CONVERTER_EXCEPTION + item);
283            } catch (final ConverterException e) {
284                verifyExpectedErrorMessage(item, e);
285            }
286        }
287    }
288
289    /**
290     * Tests the method
291     * {@link Converter#getAsObject(javax.faces.context.FacesContext, javax.faces.component.UIComponent, String)}
292     * with valid String, derived by {@link TestItems}
293     */
294    @Test
295    void shouldPassOnValidStrings() {
296        for (final ConverterTestItem<T> item : getTestItems().getValidStringTestItems()) {
297            final var result = (T) getConverter().getAsObject(getFacesContext(), getComponent(), item.getStringValue());
298            if (null != item.getTestValue()) {
299                assertEquals(item.getTestValue(), result, item.toString());
300            }
301
302        }
303    }
304}
